info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 2 at 7:20AM EDT until July 2 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of western Virginia, including the following county, Augusta, City of Staunton and City of Waynesboro.
* WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 720 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Staunton... Waynesboro... Stuarts Draft... Crimora... Fishersville... Verona... Weyers Cave... Lyndhurst... New Hope... Mount Sidney... Churchville... Fort Defiance... Hermitage... Moscow... Staunton Airport... Mount Solon... Swoope... Christian... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Augusta, VA; City of Staunton, VA; City of Waynesboro, VA
